slides.content:
# Confidence ğŸ¤

Laravel is built with testing in mind.

Support for testing with **PHPUnit** is included out of the box, and a `phpunit.xml` file is already set up for your application.

You can also use **Pest**, a more modern testing framework.

slides.title: Running Tests
slides.content:
# Artisan Command ğŸƒ

`php artisan test`

Runs all your tests and gives you a nice summary report.

slides.title: Unit vs Feature
slides.content:
# The Difference âš–ï¸

- **Unit Tests:** Test a small, isolated piece of code (e.g., a single method). Very fast.
- **Feature Tests:** Test larger chunks of code, like an HTTP request hitting a controller and talking to the DB.

slides.title: Database Testing
slides.content:
# RefreshDatabase ğŸ”„

Use the `RefreshDatabase` trait.

It automatically mimics a fresh database for EVERY test case (runs migrations inside a transaction usually).

Ensures tests don't pollute each other.
